name: Aleenta Resort & Spa Phuket Phangnga

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I visited the Aleenta for 3 nights in March 2013 for my sister's wedding. Yes, it's expensive, but it really does live up to its promise.
reviews.title: Paradise - best place I have ever stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are beautifully designed and completely luxurious, the staff are attentive, friendly and relaxed, the food is out of this world.
reviews.title: Got a lot going for it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was lucky enough to stay in the Villa Air - an incredible standalone home overlooking the beach. I felt like royalty - it really was a once-in-a-lifetime stay. My parents stayed in a loft apartment with access to a shared private pool - also beautiful accommodation.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wedding itself was stunning, much of which was owing to the brilliant Aleenta team.
reviews.title: Beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am already looking for an excuse to go back - I would recommend it to absolutely anyone looking for the ultimate retreat away from everyday life.
reviews.title: Nice but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 2nd visit to the Aleenta and we were not disappointed. We were greeted by the RDM Monghal Jancha who ensured we had everything we needed throughout our stay. The room was spotless,very quiet and restful. The cocktail bar is the perfect place to relax and watch the fantastic sunsets with the added bonus of the 'happy hour'. The breakfast on the terrace at the Aleenta is an experience in itself with swift and efficient waiter service and everything just right. We can't wait to return and be welcomed by 'Mong the Magnificent' again.
reviews.title: Return to the Aleenta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: We stayed at the Aleenta for three nights with our 3 year old and 6 year old children. We managed to get an excellent last minute rate for a one bed pool residence (we decided to move to the Aleenta from the JW Marriott in Khao Lak, which we didn't like. We were upgraded to a huge 2 bed residence on arrival. It was the largest hotel space we've ever stayed in - more like an apparent than a hotel room. Very modern, stylish and rather spectacular. The beach was wonderfully empty, huge and unspoiled. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The food was very good (we ate at the main restaurant and by the beach during our stay) and the spa treatments were the best we've ever had. All in all - a very low key, elegant place away from the crowds. Not much to do in the area (or at least if there is, it's hard to find out about it) and it would be nice if there was a shared pool to provide a focal point, but all in all an excellent place to stay if you like boutique style hotels. From a family point of view, we found it to be child friendly rather than being a family focused hotel (it's more of a couples destination) - but we felt very welcome and relaxed there. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Beautiful and stylish hotel on stunning beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: For those planning a beach wedding in Thailand, look no further than the Aleenta. What an incredible all round venue!
reviews.title: Best Wedding Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: We enjoyed a 80 person wedding on the 22nd of Feb having booked both Villa Satis and Natai (the latter is highly recommended for a large family). We had guests over from HK, Singapore, UK, Denmark and Australia and everyone truly enjoyed every moment. The service was next to none, coordinated by the ever attentive planner Bee and the food was delicately orchestrated by the Head Chef, who greeted us personally on a number of occasions during our 1 week stay.
reviews.title: Over rated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Only gripe about the Aleenta is the monopoly controlled Taxi's which makes London Taxi fares look like peanuts.
reviews.title: Secluded paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Aleenta is cool and modern, and the Loft suites imaginative in design and style. But you have to like bathrooms with no doors, and a steep staircase to go down when the call of nature hits you in the night........
reviews.title: is it an age thing?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the spa irritating: non-stop Richard Clayderman style piano music played far too loudly, while the birds twittered magically outside - so I asked for the music to be turned off.
reviews.title: Amazing amazing amazing as akways

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the music is centrally controlled and there's no on/off switch in the individual treatment rooms which is bizarre.
reviews.title: Got better after a bad start

reviews.title: Tranquility!

aka: Aleenta Resort & Spa Phuket Phangnga Hotel
description: Just minutes away from the dramatic Phangnga Bay, set directly on the beach by the Andaman Sea is the new Aleenta Resort and Spa. Following the success of its first property so much raved about on Trip Advisor, Aleenta Phuket - Phangnga retains its personal charm and yet breaks with sybaritic conformity. The modern design and clean lines allow the original philosophy of "outside-living-in" to continue and have already glazed a number of architecture magazines around the world.
